summary: 17 CFR § 240.16a-1 defines terms specifically for Section 16 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, focusing on the term "beneficial owner," which varies in meaning depending on whether it is used to determine ownership of more than ten percent of a class of equity securities or for other purposes under Section 16. The rule also outlines exceptions for certain institutions and persons, such as brokers, banks, and investment companies, who are not deemed beneficial owners if they hold securities without the intent to influence control. Additionally, it specifies what constitutes a pecuniary interest in securities, including indirect interests and performance-related fees.
